text: Ven. Herbert Ernest Campbell (bapt. 15 May 1856Liverpool, England, Church of England Baptisms, 1813–1917 – 17 June 1930) was an Anglican priest in the late nineteenth and early twentieth centuries."Campbell, Ven. Herbert Ernest", Who Was Who, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 1920–2015; online edn, Oxford University Press, 2014 ; online edn, April 2014 [, accessed 20 March 2015] Prescott was educated at Exeter College, Oxford and ordained in 1879.Crockford's Clerical Directory London, Horace Cox, 1908 After curacies in Brighton and London he was Vicar of Millom; Rector of Workington; Archdeacon of Furness; Vicar of Barrow-in-Furness; Archdeacon of Carlisle; and a Canon Residentiary at Carlisle Cathedral. He died in 1930."The Ven. H. E. Campbell". The Times (London, England), Wednesday, Jun 18, 1930; pg. 16; Issue 45542 His son Donald was also Archdeacon of Carlisle. ==References== Category:Archdeacons of Furness Category:Archdeacons of Carlisle Category:1856 births Category:1930 deaths Category:Alumni of Exeter College, Oxford
title: Ernest Campbell (priest)
